name: OFFSITE - Fabrication of 3mm Solid Vitradual Checklist
template name: OFFSITE - Fabrication of 3mm Solid Vitradual Checklist

name: Pre-fabrication
Ensure CNC machine operator daily checklist has been undertaken
Nest summary and site drawings provided by programmer, file number printed on paperwork corresponds with file programmed in CNC
Check currency of Drawings and Approved
Check Mondoclad 3mm pre-finished sheet is selected.
Insert photo of inkjet writing on back of sheet showing product, colour and batch number
Colour and sheet size corresponds with fabrication drawings and nesting.
Sheets are not bent, scratched or damaged before placing on CNC table
No metal filings located on CNC table or sheets prior to placing sheet on bed. Compressed air used to remove any debris
Machining
Fluid levels, suction pressures and functions are optimum. Correct tooling is selected and utilized
Ensure Minimum route depth thickness is maintained at .9mm
Panel numbers engraved into back of panel correspond with file numbers and fabrication drawings
Corresponding bracket sizes are written on back of panel as per fabrication drawings
Panels are checked off as machined once machining has terminated
Panels stacked neatly on edge on A frame back to back - face to face.
Fabrication
Correct tooling used to fold edges of panels. Panel returns folded neatly and square

Panel cleaned of any excess cutting lubricant or foreign debris. Back of panel is clean. Back of panel be adraided via palm sander with 40 girt sand paper at stiffener locations as per Dowsil recomendations. Locations to be cleaned with clean cloth and isopropanol prior to stiffener application.
Correct sized mill finished aluminum 6063 -T5 2.5mm 'Z' brackets run full length of folds and finish no more than 30mm from edge of panel. Correctly positioned perimeter Z bracket
Dowsil 795 Structural Silicon used to adhere stiffeners to back of panel. Dowsil 795 to be applied continuously to both sides of stiffeners 6mm thick x 6mm wide.
Insert images of Dowsil 795 been applied to stifferned as per above detail. ALSO INSERT IMAGE OF DOWSIL 795 BOX / CARTON SHOWING BATCH NUMBER OF PRODUCT.
Z' brackets fixed to folded returns via ICCONS 4.8mm Multi grip alumanium rivets at no greater than 250mm centers. Correctly fixed perimeter Z bracket
Correct Mill finished aluminum stiffeners selected 40x40x3 RHS 6060-T5 or 60x60x3 RHS 6060-T5 where required
Stiffeners cut to length to fit neatly between 'Z' brackets. Neat fitting stiffener in correct position fixed to perimeter 'Z' brackets via 40x3 EA and 4.8mm ICCONS multi grip aluminium rivets
Insert photo of completed panel showing stiffener spacings (use tape measure) and general arrangement.
Packing
Panels stacked neatly back to back - face to face with protective foam placed between panel faces for transport
Ensure panel numbers are marked off as complete
Panels are secured and wrapped ready for transport
Remove rubbish from work area. Clean workshop for next shift
ONSITE - Installation of Facade System
Pre-constructions and Removal of existing ACP and top hat framing.
Existing condition of surrounding surfaces and finished is documented and photo evidence is obtained and emailed through to Skypanel Management
Removal of sealant in a safe manner, place into bin/bags for disposal and tidy work area.
Removal of composite panels in a safe manner from facade, move to lay down area and secure ensuring work area kept tidy
Removed composite panels stacked neatly and securely strapped within the perimeter of pallets in manner suitable for lifting with a forklift to be transported to recyclers on flatbed truck
Assessment of Structure and Aluminium Framing Installation
Visually check existing structure for condition. Identify any visible cracked welds, missing fixtures and connections and take photo graphic evidence
Identify existing structure. Capture images with tape measure showing type, size, spans, centers and connections at selected locations
Insert Photos showing exisitng structure showing member sizing, spans, centers & connections at selected locations and general structure at location.
Install Air Barrier ensuring material is lapped and sealed to all adjacent strcutures
Refer to design documents to ensure tophat span design sizes are not going to be exceeded for the project. 30mm Tophat max span 1000mm at 1m spancing or 800mm span at 1200mm spacing
Ensure mill finished aluminium extrusion are utilized as per EDGE Tophat Design Report,
Insert photo of AS209 glazing adaptor showing correct position on the sub frame.

Check fixings types of aluminium subframe into structure: Fixings to be stainless steel 12ga Tek screws when fixed to steel. Fixings into concrete to be galvanised M8 Blue Tip Screw Bolts with min 40mm embedment
Ensure aluminium frames setout reflects shop drawing setout are installed plumb, level and are packed to suit existing build out as required with aluminium packers
Prior to commencement of cladding installation: Ensure other services are complete: Ensure all framing requirements are met
Insert Photos showing completed aluminum framing with components identified showing spans, tophat sizes, fixings at selected locations
Installation of 3mm Mondoclad Cladding
Ensure cladding material and colour is correct by referencing shop drawings - Mondoclad 3mm solid aluminum
Ensure appropriate stiffeners are located in back of panel as per EDGE Design documents & Skypanel Shop drawings
Ensure specific stiffener details are achieved as noted in corner situations i.e. High wind corner stiffener support connection
Ensure 3mm aluminum mill finished angles are installed with strucutural silicone to the back of panels to support all corner folds as per EDGE documents
Ensure rivet fixing of Z bracket to panel return edges spaced no more than 250mm apart
Ensure panels are defect free with no scratches and dents
Install cladding panels by mechanically fixing through 'Z' brackets to tophat support framing with 12ga bimetal SDS screws at nominated fixing centers.
Ensure all panels are installed in the same direction as indicated on the protective film
Ensure panel joint consistancy is maintianed
Ensure panels are installed plumb, square and true, and within Skypanel tolerances
Ensure panels are installed in correct positions by checking engraving on back of sheet corresponds with position on shop drawings
Insert Photos of installed panel, panel widths, junctions, 12ga bi metal screws and fixing centers at selected locations
Caulking of panels
Ensure closed cell backing rod is applied correctly
Ensure Black Admil Prosil 41LM sealant is installed correctly and consistently. Min depth of sealant to be 8mm
Ensure all penetrations are caulked
Ensure plastic film is removed and caulking and glue residues are properly cleaned from cladding surface
Insert photos of sealed panels at selected locations
Hold Point - Approval of caulking required by Duratec before demobilising from area
Installation of Glazing Adaptors
Ensure the correct adaptor is selected
Ensure the adaptor seal is installed in the adaptor correctly.
insert photo of AS209 glazing adaptor & installed panel.
Ensure AS104 adaptor is fully engaged to AS209 adaptor
insert photo of installed AS104 adaptor
Drawing Upload & Access
Details
Ensure safest access method is selected and utilized, ensuring scaffold is signed off as complete and EWP/plant daily pre starts are undertaken and documented
Check dimensions nominated on shop drawings match the dimensions onsite with regard to existing cladding to be removed and replaced
